content:
**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # HP Inc. (HPQ) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq): - **Closing Price**: $38.72 - **Market Capitalization**: $37.82 billion - **52-Week Range**: $24.08 - $39.81 - **Dividend Yield**: 2.85% (quarterly dividend $0.2763/share, ex-date Sep 11, 2024) - **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: 11.42 - **EV/EBITDA**: 8.15 ## Company Overview (184 words) HP Inc. (HPQ), spun off from Hewlett-Packard in 2015, is a leading global provider of personal computing and printing solutions. The company operates in two primary segments: Personal Systems (PS), which includes laptops, desktops, workstations, and displays, accounting for ~65% of revenue; and Printing (Print), encompassing printers, ink, toner, and 3D printing supplies. HPQ serves consumers, small/medium businesses (SMBs), enterprises, and governments across 170+ countries, with a focus on hybrid work, AI-enhanced devices, and subscription-based printing services like Instant Ink. In FY2023, HPQ generated $53.7 billion in revenue, driven by recurring print supplies (35%+ gross margins) and commercial PC refreshes. Despite macroeconomic headwinds like PC market contraction, HPQ maintains leadership in commercial printing and a top-3 position in global PCs, emphasizing innovation in AI PCs (e.g., Copilot+ certified devices) and sustainability (e.g., recycled materials in 30%+ of products). With $2.5B+ in annual free cash flow, HPQ supports dividends, buybacks ($1.4B in FY2024), and R&D (~$1.5B annually). ## Recent Developments - **Q3 FY2024 Earnings (Reported Aug 29, 2024)**: Revenue $13.52B (-2% YoY); GAAP net earnings $321M (EPS $0.50); Non-GAAP EPS $0.86 (beat estimates by $0.11). Personal Systems revenue $8.22B (-3%); Printing $5.30B (+1%). Q4 FY2024 guidance: Revenue $13.6-14.0B; Non-GAAP EPS $0.75-0.85. - **Q2 FY2024 Earnings (May 28, 2024)**: Revenue $13.63B (+0.2% YoY); Non-GAAP EPS $0.87. - **Product Launches (Sep 2024)**: OmniBook X AI PC (Snapdragon X Elite, Copilot+ certified, available Oct 2024); EliteBook Ultra with AMD Ryzen AI PRO (announced Sep 24, 2024). - **Leadership Changes (Sep 10, 2024)**: CFO Marie Myers to retire; interim CFO Tarek Robbiati appointed. - **Sustainability Milestone (Oct 1, 2024)**: Achieved 30% recycled plastic content across portfolio, aligning with 2030 net-zero goals. - **Online Buzz (Reddit/Twitter, Oct 2024)**: Discussions highlight AI PC ramp optimism but concerns over PC inventory glut and China tariffs. ## Growth Strategy - **AI PC Ramp**: Targeting 20%+ of shipments as AI-enabled by CY2025 (CEO Enrique Lores, Q3 call); partnerships with Qualcomm, AMD, Intel for NPU-equipped devices. - **Commercial Focus**: 60%+ of PS revenue from commercial (up from 55% in 2023); Windows 10 end-of-support (Oct 2025) to drive 10-15% PC refresh. - **Print Subscriptions**: Instant Ink/HP+ grew 15% YoY (Q3); goal of 20M subscribers by 2025. - **Margin Expansion**: Supply chain savings ($400M annualized) and pricing discipline to boost operating margin to 6-7% in FY2025. - **Emerging Markets**: Double-digit growth in India/Brazil; AI edge printing for SMBs. ## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds | Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds | |--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Company** | - Printing supplies resilient (Q3 +4% YoY).
- Strong FCF ($1.1B Q3) funds $1.5B buybacks/dividends.
- AI PC early-mover (5% attach rate Q3). | - PS shipment declines (Q3 -5%).
- Inventory destocking ($300M headwind).
- CFO transition uncertainty. | | **Sector** | - PC refresh cycle (Windows 11/10 EOS).
- AI PC market: 50M units CY2025 (IDC).
- Hybrid work sustains printing demand. | - Global PC shipments -1% CY2024 (Gartner).
- China PC restrictions/tariffs (HPQ 10% rev exposure).
- Macro slowdown (US consumer soft). | ## Existing Products/Services - **Personal Systems**: Laptops (Pavilion, Envy, Spectre, OmniBook; 60% rev), Desktops/Workstations (Z series), Displays. - **Printing**: Inkjet/Laser Printers (OfficeJet, LaserJet), Supplies (ink/toner; 70% Print profit), Managed Print Services, Instant Ink subscription. - **Services**: HP Wolf Security (endpoint protection), Device-as-a-Service (DaaS). ## New Products/Services/Projects - **AI PCs (Launching Q4 2024-CY2025)**: OmniBook X, Elite x360 1040 G11 (Qualcomm/Intel/AMD chips); NPU for local AI (e.g., Recall feature). - **HP AI Studio (Announced Sep 2024)**: Open-source tools for enterprise AI app development on HP devices. - **3D Printing Expansion**: Jet Fusion series enhancements for industrial prototyping (partnership with Evonik for materials, Sep 2024). - **Sustainability Projects**: Ocean-bound plastic in printers (target 25K tons by 2026). ## Market Share Approximations (Q2 2024, IDC/Gartner) - **Global PC Shipments**: 21.6% (2nd place; Lenovo 23.2%, Dell 15.3%). - **US PC**: 25.1%. - **Commercial PCs**: ~22%. - **Inkjet Printing**: 42% (leader). - **Laser Printing**: 18%. - **Print Supplies**: 35-40% (recurring dominance). ## Market Share Forecast - **CY2024**: Flat at 21-22% (PC market -1%; HP stable via commercial share gains). - **CY2025**: +1-2% to 22-23% (AI PC tailwinds; sector +5-7%). Printing steady at 40%+ (subscription growth offsets hardware weakness). ## Competitor Comparison (Q2 2024 Metrics, IDC/Yahoo Finance) | Metric | HPQ | Lenovo (LNVGY) | Dell (DELL) | Apple (AAPL) | |---------------------|--------------|----------------|---------------|--------------| | **PC Mkt Share** | 21.6% | 23.2% | 15.3% | 8.8% | | **Q2 Rev (B)** | $13.6 | $13.5 | $22.2 | N/A (Mac) | | **P/E Ratio** | 11.4 | 14.2 | 25.1 | 34.5 | | **EV/EBITDA** | 8.2 | 9.8 | 12.4 | 25.8 | | **Key Edge** | Printing + AI PCs | Volume leader | Servers/Enterprise | Premium consumer | HPQ trades at a discount to peers on valuation; superior print moat vs. Dell/Lenovo. ## Partnerships, M&A, Clients - **Partnerships**: NVIDIA (AI Omniverse on HP workstations, renewed Jun 2024); Qualcomm/AMD/Intel (AI PC chips); Microsoft (Copilot+ integration); Evonik (3D materials). - **M&A**: No major deals in past 6 months. Last notable: Acquired Poly (audio) for $1.7B (2022, integrated into devices). - **Current Major Clients**: Enterprises (50% PS rev: e.g., Fortune 500 via DaaS); Governments (e.g., US DoD contracts); SMBs (Instant Ink). - **Potential Clients**: AI-focused firms (e.g., expanding with data centers via NVIDIA tie-up); Emerging: Indian SMBs (double-digit growth). ## Other Qualitative Measures - **Moat**: 85% print supplies recurring rev; top-tier supply chain (Thailand/Vietnam hubs). - **ESG**: A- rating (S&P); 89% renewable energy (2024 goal). - **Risks**: Geopolitical (China 25% mfg); cyclical PC demand. - **Analyst Sentiment (Oct 2024)**: 14 Buy/10 Hold/1 Sell (Yahoo); avg PT $39.50 (modest 2% upside). ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating**: **7/10 (Hold/Buy)** â€“ Attractive valuation (11x P/E vs. sector 18x), printing stability, and AI PC upside outweigh PC headwinds. Suitable for moderate risk/growth portfolio seeking 10-15% total return (dividend + modest appreciation). - **Fair Value Estimate**: $48 (24% upside). Based on 13x FY2025 EPS ($3.35 est., consensus) + 3% terminal yield; DCF implies $45-52 range assuming 3% rev CAGR, 7% margins.
